bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 26 (Wednesday, February 8, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SHERRILL:H.R. 880.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 18 of Section 8 of Article 1 of the Constitution ofthe United States of America.The single subject of this legislation is:Establish grant funding for the creation of ContinuingMedical Education programming specific to cardiovasculardisease and health in women.[Page H782]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Heart Health Enhancement through Access to Research and Training Act

This bill authorizes grants for continuing medical education programs for physicians on preventing, identifying, and treating cardiovascular disease in women. The Department of Health and Human Services may award the grants to hospitals, public health departments, medical or other health professional schools, or other eligible entities.

bill.title: Heart Health Enhancement through Access to Research and Training Act

item.title: Heart Health Enhancement through Access to Research and Training Act
Heart Health Enhancement through Access to Research and Training Act
To establish a program to provide for women's heart health continuing medical education, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
